title: Elon Musk fires controversial Twitter lawyer over suppressing Hunter story, handling the 'Twitter Files'
description:
Just when you thought it was safe to be a lawyer at Twitter, here comes Elon Musk to exit you from the company. Today it was general counsel James Baker. You may remember him from such files as "The Twitter Files," where his name came up as a driving force behind the bird app censoring the Hunter Biden laptop story and anyone who tried to share it.

Elon and James had a kibitz today. Musk was not amused. Baker is not employed.

In light of concerns about Baker’s possible role in suppression of information important to the public dialogue, he was exited from Twitter today
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 6, 2022


Yes. His explanation was …unconvincing.
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 6, 2022

James Baker has lived a fascinating life. Prior to being the general council for Twitter, he was the general counsel for the FBI. There, he had his fingers in RussiaGate with the discredited Steele Dossier. He was fired from the FBI in 2018 for leaking to the press. He was then hired by Twitter, where he censored the press instead.

That includes getting his hand on the first batch of "Twitter Files" before they found their way to independent journalists Matt Taibbi and Bari Weiss. There was supposed to be a cornucopia of more files dropped over the weekend that got held up. Jim Baker is why.

We can now tell you part of the reason why. On Tuesday, Twitter Deputy General Counsel (and former FBI General Counsel) Jim Baker was fired. Among the reasons? Vetting the first batch of “Twitter Files” – without knowledge of new management.
— Matt Taibbi (@mtaibbi) December 6, 2022

Unclear at this time is if James Baker has accepted the job as an "analyst" at MSNBC yet. I'd say CNN might be an option, but they are in the process of yeeting people out the door as well.

The rest of us wait anxiously for the next batch of Twitter Files. I can't imagine there would be much more on Hunter. The open question is who's next?

title: 'The Office' star Mindy Kaling bemoans how 'inappropriate' the show is today, doesn't hear the words coming out of her mouth
description:
SR-71 had a song called "Politically Incorrect" in 2000 with the line "you couldn't make Blazing Saddles today." A reference to how much times had changed over more than a quarter of a century. Now it's "you couldn't make The Office today," a show that's been gone for less than ten years. The latest person to make the claim is Mindy Kaling, who both starred in and WROTE the show.

She bemoaned on GMA this morning (emphasis mine", "The writers who I’m still in touch with now, we always talk about how so much of that show we probably couldn’t make now. Tastes have changed, and honestly what offends people has changed so much now. I think that actually is one of the reasons the show is popular, because people feel like there’s something kind of fearless about it or taboo that it talks about on the show."

The Office is REVERED here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website. There are two groups of people in this world. Those who grasp the brilliance of The Office. And unfunny people with a metal poles crammed up their rectums. If America would learn about racial understanding from Michael and Darryl, we'd all be in a better place.

But look again at what Mindy said. You couldn't make the show today because of how "inappropriate" it is...even though it's STILL POPULAR. "Tastes" and what "offends people" has allegedly changed, even though in 2000 the show was the most streamed show during the pandemic. You most certainly CAN still make the show today. Mindy says so herself. She just doesn't realize she said so.

The only ones offended and whose "tastes" have changed are the permaoffended woke twats working in Hollywood, writing for digital tabloids in Park Slope, and who have recently been fired from Twitter. Normal people, a vast majority of us, still think that brand of comedy is funny.

You could still make The Office today, or a show like The Office. It's not that you can't. It's that handful of people won't, and lecture the rest of us as to why.

title: Oh-my: Post-Liver King, Joe Rogan calls on The Rock to come clean about using steroids
description:
The country is still in shock that the "Liver King" has been taking steroids the entire time. He's super sorry about it too. Liver said so in a video where he was in full character, with his shirt off, showing his roided-up body he's sorry about. Joe Rogan was not impressed, and there is another actor he thinks should come clean about not being clean. Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson.

Methinks this is going to cause some media buzz.

Joe Rogan: The Rock Is On 'Roids!? & The Rest Of These Super Hero Actors Are Juiced To The Gills!! youtu.be

The Rock should come clean right now. He should make a video in response to the Liver King video like, "I need to talk to you because The Rock’s been lying." There’s not a f*cking chance in hell he’s clean, not a chance in hell as big as The Rock is at fifty.

To be clear, Rogan was half-doing schtick. He also wasn't saying with authority The Rock does or doesn't use. Rogan presented the schtick without evidence. Critics say the eyeball test is evidence enough. But it's not like Rogan presented a peer-reviewed study independently fact-checked by independent fact-checkers.

Rogan's point is less about the steroids and more about lying about it. When it comes to people like The Rock and The Liver King who are advocating for an allegedly healthy lifestyle, "There’s a responsibility that you have to the people that are listening to you."

It will be interesting to see if The Rock responds. The last time The Rock said anything about Rogan, it was when The Rock saw a video put out by a shadowy, dark-money progressive SuperPAC implying that Rogan was racist.

Rogan is hardly the first person to accuse a professional wrestler of taking steroids. He's just the first #1 podcaster in the world to make an accusation about one of the top A-list actors. If The Rock smells what his team of publicists are cooking, my money is on everyone pretending this video never happened.

title: 'Screw Hitler': Alex Jones goes off on epic minute-long rant on how much he hates nazis
description:
We here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website aren't one for hyperbole. But this is the most epic Alex Jones rant you're ever going to hear.

Jones sat down with Crowder for an exclusive about his now-infamous interview with Ye. You know, the Hitler one. This one's for all on the left and in the media (but I repeat myself) who say the right isn't doing enough to denounce Hitler: Hitler. Is. Bad.

Quite possibly the most EPIC rant from Alex Jones ever. pic.twitter.com/JDWwZmuu3R
— Steven Crowder (@scrowder) December 6, 2022
Hitler was a disaster.
Hitler was an occultist.
Hitler was a pedophile.
Hitler was horrible.
Screw Hitler.
Burn in hell Hitler.

Alex went into further detail about what went on behind the scenes with Ye and his entourage, and how he felt he was set up for a publicity stunt. You can listen to Jones's exclusive comments and more on today's show.

ALEX JONES BREAKS SILENCE ON YE INTERVIEW! | Louder with Crowder www.youtube.com

title: Watch: English teacher claims teaching kids to talk and write good is white supremacy, so she refuses to
description:
A popular criticism of homeschooling your children is that they will grow up to be uneducated rubes. The criticism tends to be leveled by progressive twits like this alleged English teacher, who has declared proper grammar and writing to be white supremacy. THIS is what your kid is missing out on by not sending them to public school. Boy oh boy, don't you feel stupid now homeschool parent!

According to Fox News, this specimen "teaches" "English" at a California High School.

English teacher says that grammar and writing rules are based in white supremacy so she tries to undermine it in her classroom pic.twitter.com/uKVs3MO1ih
— Libs of TikTok (@libsoftiktok) December 4, 2022

Her class studies linguistics and the rules on how she claims people really communicate "instead of the made-up rules that white supremacy created for when we write papers and stuff."

Made-up, white supremacy rules like "always cite your sources." Citing your sources is a made-up rule created by "westerners in power." That makes citing your sources racist and bad.

This part's my favorite, what she refers to as the "language of respectability":

Just because your teachers, your professors, and your boss may expect you to write and speak in a certain way that may not be natural to you...

Grammar? Citing Sources? Communicating gooder? That's all the "white mainstream culture of public school life." At least, according to this person.

It's remarkable that your homeschooled student can even function in modern society not having this public school knowledge shared with them. After all, you as a parent are not licensed to teach. This woman is.

title: Elon Musk, Ron DeSantis BOTH named finalists for Time's 'Person of the Year,' and we can't wait for the outrage
description:
Time Magazine still exists for some reason. And every year they name their 'Person of the Year,' also for some reason. The ten finalists were released today, and there are two names who -- if given this career-defining honor -- will provide us with the most entertainment: Elon Musk and Ron DeSantis.

.@TIME releases its 2022 Person of the Year shortlist pic.twitter.com/8rTCTIJUCY
— Morning Joe (@Morning_Joe) December 5, 2022

Let's not get it twisted. I'm in no way advocating that the POTY matters. Though Janet Yellen should be disqualified for her problematic comments about black people. Vegas thinks it's fait accompli that the "award" will go to Volodymyr Zelenskyy since that would be the most virtue-signalish thing to do, Though "Gun Safety Advocates" provides strong competition.

I just ask you to join me in praying to the gods of content that the award goes to either Elon Musk or Ron DeSantis. The meltdowns for either will be glorious.

We got a taste of anti-Elon meltdowns when he was given the award in 2021. Musk upped his person-of-the-yeariness in 2022 by buying Twitter. Leftists and the media (but I repeat myself) refuse to calm down about it. If Elon is awarded another magazine cover, the reaction will be similar to feeding Alka-Seltzer to a pigeon. With any luck, Ligma Johnson will write the accompanying article.

A Ron DeSantis victory would be interesting because it wouldn't be exclusively liberals melting down. The left would still be leading the charge though. They spent a year calling DeSantis a killer and elventy different kinds of a -phobic. Nothing stuck. He faced it all and he stood tall. The only thing left is to do 2024 his way.

So to the gods of content, I beseech you. Please, in your divine wisdom, grant onto either man this meaningless award and allow it to deliver an abundance of meltdowns, angry tweets, and shakyfists. In the name of the holy page view, we pray. Amen.

title: Watch: Public school superintendent admits to sexual fantasies about children, still has a job
description:
An Ohio school superintendent's sexual (and criminal) fantasies involving children has been made public. Yet, somehow, he still has a job serving more than 16,000 students in 20 schools. Parents from those schools and of those students aren't happy about it. Nor should anyone with any semblance of a conscience.

As reported by citizen journalist Libs of TikTok, Superintendent Matt Miller's alleged sexual fantasies and desires involving students -- including raping and drugging minors -- have been revealed in court documents. Parents demanded his resignation at a recent school board meeting.

SCOOP: Documents reveal superintendent of @LakotaDistrict’s alleged sexual fantasies and desires involving students- including raping and drugging minors

He’s still employed there and parents are demanding his resignation and an investigation.

More on this story shortly pic.twitter.com/8rRhuBgzxV
— Libs of TikTok (@libsoftiktok) December 6, 2022

It began when a parent filed a police report against the superintendent and provided police with copies of text messages she received, including ones between Miller and his ex-wife where he seemingly admitted to fantasizing about raping minors. During an interview with police, the ex-wife "alleged that her ex-husband used to traffick her to other men, sent her child pornography, and asked her to molest children in the school district, even her own son."

At one point he had asked me - I have a friend who has three little boys… and he said I should volunteer to watch the boys so the parents could go out. Give them sleeping pills, molest them for him and videotape it.

We're not even at the sick part yet. An honorable scumbag could have denied everything and called his ex-wife a liar. Miller didn't deny the allegations at all. He told investigators it was all pillow talk and that he and his ex-wife would role-play "which on at least one occasion included a discussion of drugging, molesting, and recording three kids."

The Butler County Sheriff's Office claimed there wasn't "probable cause" to bring criminal charges against Miller, even though they didn't investigate any of his electronic devices. The school board didn't find "any wrongdoing" in their "investigation" either.

To recap, a school superintendent not only has sexual fantasies about raping and drugging children, he admits having those fantasies to the police. But because he hasn't acted on those fantasies yet - yet - he still has a job that gives him access to SIXTEEN THOUSAND CHILDREN. This is the world we are living in now.

title: Have you noticed Twitter hasn't tried to 'cancel' Chris Pratt since Elon Musk fired the trend curation team?
description:
It used to be clockwork. Actor Chris Pratt would do something that reminded everyone he exists, and some form of "cancel Chris Pratt" would trend on Twitter. Then Elon Musk fired the Twitter Curation team. They were the commie-as-f*ck employees tasked with curating what you saw trend Now, two major movie trailers later and no one has thrown a Chris Pratt is over party. Weird, right?

I was just thinking about this, because when the trailer for the Guardian of the Galaxy Christmas Special dropped, I was expecting the usual suspects to cancel the "worst" Chris. Yet even with new trailers for Super Mario Brothers and Guardians 3, it's conspicuously quiet.

It’s time to face the music.

Watch the brand-new trailer for Marvel Studios’ Guardians of the Galaxy Volume 3 that just debuted at Brazil Comic Con #CCXP2022. Only in theaters May 5, 2023. #GotGVol3 pic.twitter.com/fIRj9i4PVx
— Guardians of the Galaxy (@Guardians) December 1, 2022

Prior to Elon buying Twitter, all it took was Pratt showing up in the Thor trailer for "Twitter" to "demand" Pratt be canceled. Or, when the actor would post something about his family. You see, the knock on Pratt (by idiots) is that he likes Jesus, America, and hunting. And because he uses his platform to make millions of people happy and NOT attack Trump supporters, leftists hate him. Presumably, the same leftists who would curate what they wanted to trend on Twitter. Then, other leftists who hate him and who work in digital media would write about how Pratt was being canceled on Twitter. It was a never-ending cycle.

It's not just a lack of Cancelling Chris. Japanese Twitter users noticed after a reporter complained she had no one left at Twitter to call anymore to make sure her "news" articles trended, the bird app was becoming more pleasant:

Users appear to consider the new trending list as more authentic than the politics-infused list allegedly curated by Twitter, which is a fair assumption. Japanese users have compared this list to previous days where almost all trending topics were political in nature. The user who posted the list called the new trends “peaceful” and joked about how the curation team must have spend their time “sorting out topics like this every day”.

It turns out that when Twitter employees don't have their finger on the scale, Twitter users don't care about the political topics those Twitter employees want them to care about. Like, for example, one of the few A-List actors who doesn't validate the now former Twitter employees' "commie as f*ck" political worldviews.

Dig through Twitter, I'm sure you will find a hand full of dinkuses angry about Pratt's existence. But they stayed a handful of dinkuses and weren;t turned into a national trend. With no one to cherry-pick a few tweets to create the illusion the internet hates Chris Pratt, the internet doesn't hate Chris Pratt.

Or, it's all a coincidence we're reading too much in too. There have been a number of those coincidences since Elon took over.
